content.description:
This problem starts on the right hand hold of

Anna Grace

. Move your left hand to a crimp then bump to a positive side pull. Match your right foot and right hand on the starting hold, then move your hand far right to a positive two-finger pocket. From there, set your feet and throw a left hand to the sloper and right hand above that. Top out. I really just loved the move to the two finger pocket. It takes balance and a bit of technique and was just something different than what I normally gravitate toward.
content.protection: Pads and a spotter. There's potential for a poor landing depending on how you fall.
content.location:
Start on the right hand hold of

Anna Grace

on the Manchester Boulder.

content.description: Sit start with a left hand sidepull and a right hand edge. From there, reach a left hand pocket, bump the left hand further to a pinch, gain a good right hand dish, reach a left hand dish, follow to the lip, and use the bumps to mantel atop the boulder.
content.protection: A pad or two. The landing is great, but there is a tree behind the problem.
content.location:
It climbs the east face of Manchester, just to the left of

Anna Grace

.

content.description: Squat start with hands matched at the bottom of the arete on bumps. From there, work along the arete to its apex, and reach a great dish on top for an easy mantel.
content.protection: A pair of pads. The immediate landing is great, but there are some rocks surrounding it.
content.location: It climbs the south arete of Manchester.

content.description:
This is to the right of

Anna Grace

. Start on a sidepull and shoot straight up to a huge sloper with your left hand. It is not an easy move. Get your feet up, and then throw right to a positive but sharp edge. Top out.
content.protection: Pad and spotter. Not the best landing in the world. Just pay attention.
content.location:
This is to the right of

Anna Grace

. Get to the Brain Boulder and head south. The problem is on the east side of the boulder.

content.description:
If you see move 2 or move 3, section 4, you might not be able to reach the holds, this is the Height Dependency Clause.

If you know of a F.A. party or ascent, please let me know, and I can change the info to be accurate.
content.location: Start sitting on the most uphill part of the boulder with your left hand on an arete and your right hand in a hueco. This has boulder right behind it that could be major back slap potential if you don't pad it.

content.description:
This is on the west side of the Manchester Boulder. It is a great problem during hot summers. It lies in the shade and has a good landing.

Start on two sidepulls and heads upward. The crux is coming over the top and a big move to a positive hold on the right side. Commit and head up.
content.protection: Good landing. Pad and spotter like always.
content.location: On the west side of the boulder, which is located south of the Brain Boulder.
